What is the purpose of the "mmrsalt" parameter when signing a message with Verus?

The "mmrsalt" parameter is used to protect the privacy of leaf nodes of the Merkle Mountain Range (MMR) when signing a message with Verus. It is an optional string parameter that helps to maintain the privacy of the leaf nodes.

ign
 "mmrdata":[{"filename | vdxfdata | message | serializedhex | serializedbase64 | datahash":"str"}], (array, optional) Alternate to single data parameters, this enables an MMR signing
       "mmrsalt":["salt":"str"],            (string, optional) Protects privacy of leaf nodes of the MMR
       "mmrhashtype":"sha256" | "sha256D" | "blake2b" | "keccak256", (string, optional) Default is blake2b
       "priormmr":"[{"idxhash":,"utxoref":{}}]",  (array, optional) When growing an MMR, the prior hashes can be used to construct the MMR and root w/o data
 "vdxfkeys":["vdxfkey", ...],                 (array, optional) Array of vdxfkeys or ID i-addresses
 "vdxfkeynames":["vdxfkeyname", ...],             (array, optional) Array of vdxfkey names or fully qualified friendly IDs
 "boundhashes":["hexhash", ...],               (array, optional) Array of bound hash values
 "hashtype":"str",                      (string, optional) one of: "sha256", "sha256D", "blake2b", "keccak256", defaults to sha256
 "signature":"base64str",                   (string, optional) The current signature of the message encoded in base 64 if multisig ID
 "encrypttoaddress":"saplingaddress",             (string, optional) If present, encrypts and optionally returns encrypted data.
                                          All data can be decrypted with the incoming viewing key, and a unique decryption key can
                                          be generated for each sub-object.
 "createmmr":"bool",                     (bool, optional)  If this is true, OR there is more than one item to sign, returns processed data, MMRs, and root signature
}
./raw_text_input_api_text/signdata
How can I specify the hash type to use when signing a message with Verus?

You can specify the hash type to use when signing a message with Verus by using the "mmrhashtype" or "hashtype" parameter. The available options are "sha256", "sha256D", "blake2b", and "keccak256". If not specified, the default hash type is "blake2b".

What is the purpose of the "priormmr" parameter when signing a message with Verus?

The "priormmr" parameter is used when growing an MMR, and it allows Verus to construct the MMR and root without data by using the prior hashes. It is an optional array parameter that contains the prior hashes.

How can I encrypt a signed message with Verus, and what is required to decrypt it?

You can encrypt a signed message with Verus by using the "encrypttoaddress" parameter, which specifies the sapling address to encrypt to. The encrypted data can be decrypted with the incoming viewing key, and a unique decryption key can be generated for each sub-object.
